{"post_stream":{"posts":[{"id":3295995,"name":"Dustin Spicuzza","username":"virtuald","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/virtuald/{size}/65268_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T21:04:04.341Z","cooked":"

The limelight docs recommend this brainboxes switch, but doesn’t seem to be available there? There’s lots of other options on amazon but they all seem to be the wrong voltage range… has anyone found a similar thing that would meet FRC requirements?

","post_number":1,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-01-27T21:04:04.341Z","reply_count":0,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":35,"reads":283,"readers_count":282,"score":231.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":452317,"topic_slug":"brainboxes-switch-alternative","display_username":"Dustin Spicuzza","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://www.amazon.com/BRAINBOXES-SW-005-Brainboxes-Unmanaged-Ethernet/dp/B07PRZ2R1P/","internal":false,"reflection":false,"title":"Amazon.com","clicks":59}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":11063,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer"},"post_url":"/t/brainboxes-switch-alternative/452317/1","custom_user_title":"RobotPy Guy, WPILib Developer","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null,"can_vote":false},{"id":3295997,"name":"Joe Ross","username":"Joe_Ross","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/joe_ross/{size}/37_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-27T21:06:40.849Z","cooked":"
Zebraswitch 2.0 - The Zebracorns upgraded Ethernet switch paper CD-Media: Papers
In this paper, we cover our upgraded process for Ethernet switching on our robots. We cover the general rules we try to live by when it comes to the radio and adjacent components, the legal ways to connect and power the radio, and the assembly of the switch and the power regulator. https://team900.org/blog/2023-ZebraSwitch-2.0/ Direct PDF link: ZebraSwitch 2.0.pdf - Google Drive

Digikey has some in stock. They also have a $65 voucher for FRC teams.

Chris_Ely:

Digikey has some in stock

Came here to say this. Also, the SW-008 is an 8-port version of the same thing and is available on amazon as well (if thats the vendor you need to go through for some reason)

I would try and find one that can tolerate a lower minimum input voltage like 5V. The brainboxes take 5-30V. I’ve bought this 5 port one: https://a.co/d/9VJFIRL and this 8 port one: https://a.co/d/eQXWvPV

I knew there were non-industrial 8-port versions available! Our electrical guy insisted on SW-508. Now I have to design a custom mount for it.

Clearly you just need a DIN rail installed on your bot! (/s)

We use this switch. It even has redundant power inputs. It’s very robust, and an 8 port model is also available.

https://a.co/d/4SJUA2p

","post_number":9,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-01-29T20:11:50.589Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":null,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":0,"reads":99,"readers_count":98,"score":24.8,"yours":false,"topic_id":452317,"topic_slug":"brainboxes-switch-alternative","display_username":"viggy96","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"link_counts":[{"url":"https://a.co/d/4SJUA2p","internal":false,"reflection":false,"clicks":38}],"read":true,"user_title":"","bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":24613,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart"},"post_url":"/t/brainboxes-switch-alternative/452317/9","custom_user_title":"418 Mentor | Tries to be smart","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3297304,"name":"Domtech","username":"Domtech","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/domtech/{size}/138487_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-29T20:18:44.601Z","cooked":"

How are you powering it?

The listing doesn’t say what voltage it takes, but from the customer image it looks like the minimum input is 12 Volts.

","post_number":10,"post_type":1,"posts_count":12,"updated_at":"2024-01-29T20:18:44.601Z","reply_count":1,"reply_to_post_number":9,"quote_count":0,"incoming_link_count":1,"reads":88,"readers_count":87,"score":27.6,"yours":false,"topic_id":452317,"topic_slug":"brainboxes-switch-alternative","display_username":"Domtech","primary_group_name":null,"flair_name":null,"flair_url":null,"flair_bg_color":null,"flair_color":null,"flair_group_id":null,"badges_granted":[],"version":1,"can_edit":false,"can_delete":false,"can_recover":false,"can_see_hidden_post":true,"can_wiki":false,"read":true,"user_title":"","reply_to_user":{"id":24613,"username":"viggy96","name":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png"},"bookmarked":false,"actions_summary":[],"moderator":false,"admin":false,"staff":false,"user_id":14045,"hidden":false,"trust_level":2,"deleted_at":null,"user_deleted":false,"edit_reason":null,"can_view_edit_history":true,"wiki":false,"user_custom_fields":{"user_field_4":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor"},"post_url":"/t/brainboxes-switch-alternative/452317/10","custom_user_title":"Robototes Lead Mech Mentor","reactions":[],"current_user_reaction":null,"reaction_users_count":0,"current_user_used_main_reaction":false,"can_accept_answer":false,"can_unaccept_answer":false,"accepted_answer":false,"topic_accepted_answer":null},{"id":3297309,"name":"viggy96","username":"viggy96","avatar_template":"/user_avatar/www.chiefdelphi.com/viggy96/{size}/252784_2.png","created_at":"2024-01-29T20:21:55.640Z","cooked":"

If you scroll down on the product page you’ll see it accepts 12V - 56V. We used to just get a random 12V output buck boost off Amazon. Now we’ve got a few adjustable buck converters (DC-DC Buck Boost Converter Module 5A - DFRobot).

I plan on wiring the secondary power input to the VRM, for redundancy.
